New Records: Adam Zampa took 4/25, the best bowling figures for Australia in the match
Key Match Events: Dilshan Madushanka's double-wicket maiden early in the chase
Mitchell Marsh hit nine boundaries in the first 12 overs
Josh Inglis and Marnus Labuschagne's 77-run stand helped stabilize the Australia chase
David Warner took a brilliant catch to dismiss Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's new skipper Kusal Mendis called it right at the toss and elected to bat first, opining that a total in the range of 280-300 would be safe for his side
Post-Match Reflections: The victory sees Australia improve to eighth on the World Cup standings, while Sri Lanka remain winless and with a mountain of work to do to stay in contention for a semi-final berth
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia finally had a breakthrough in the 21st over when Nissanka (61) pulled a Pat Cummins delivery in the deep and ended up placing it towards the mid-wicket region
David Warner ran across the ground in the deep and took a brilliant catch to dismiss Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
Others: Australia enjoy a head-to-head advantage over Sri Lanka, having won 63 games to 35 losses
